intro: Jumellea ambongensis, commonly known as the Ambongensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Jumellea ambongensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
